channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: HDB Starts Taking Orders for One of Year’s Biggest India IPOs
item.description: HDB Financial Services Ltd. began taking orders for one of India’s biggest initial public offerings this year, in a deal that may fetch 125 billion rupees ($1.5 billion) as the shadow lender seeks to benefit from the recent rally in stock prices.
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Asian Stocks Climb With Focus on Mideast Truce: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia edged higher as the Israel-Iran truce appeared to hold and Treasury traders ramped up bets for US interest rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Jiyeun Lee

media:content.media:description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated to lawmakers that the central bank is in no rush to lower interest rates while waiting for more clarity on the economic impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs. “For the time being, we are well positioned to wait to learn more about the likely course of the economy before considering any adjustments to our policy stance,” Powell said Tuesday in remarks before the House Financial Services Committee.

item.title: WuXi AppTec-Backed MegaRobo Is Said to Plan Hong Kong IPO
item.description: MegaRobo Technologies Co. is planning a Hong Kong initial public offering as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the matter, amid a jump in stocks from the biotechnology sector.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian, Julia Fioretti

item.title: Indonesian Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati on Budget Plans
item.description: Indonesia’s finance minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati says the Southeast Asian country is on track to keep a modest budget deficit this year in an interview with Haslinda Amin. She speaks with Bloomberg Television on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank in Beijing. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: There’s Another Ceasefire That’s Ticking
item.description: Whatever Trump does on July 8, at least some tariffs are here to stay.
item.dc:creator: John Authers

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump arrives for a dinner at Huis ten Bosch Palace during the 2025 NATO Summit in The Hague, Netherlands, on June 24, 2025.

item.title: Czech Central Bank to Hold Rates and May Signal Longer Break
item.description: The Czech central bank will probably halt interest rate cuts again, with investors awaiting clues about the outlook that may signal a longer pause or even the end of monetary easing.
item.dc:creator: Peter Laca

item.title: Billionaire Jacobs’ QXO Seeks $2 Billion in Share Sale
item.description: QXO Inc. is seeking to raise $2 billion in a share sale, as the building products distributor led by billionaire Brad Jacobs pursues a takeover.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Brad Jacobs, chairman and chief executive officer of QXO Inc., during the Bloomberg Invest event in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. The conference invites leaders in asset management, banking, wealth, and private markets to track, dissect, and predict the future's greatest changes, risks and opportunities.

item.title: Oil Ticks Higher After Two-Day Slump as Traders Assess Ceasefire
item.description: Oil edged higher — after posting the biggest two-day decline since 2022 — as traders assessed the Iran-Israel ceasefire, and an industry report that pointed to another drop in US crude stockpiles.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: The LyondellBasell Houston refinery in Houston, Texas, US, on Monday June 23, 2025. Efforts to de-escalate the Middle East conflict spurred a selloff in oil, easing concerns about inflation and driving stocks higher on hopes the Federal Reserve will have room to cut rates despite Jerome Powell's wait-and-see signals.

item.title: China’s Li Highlights Entrepreneurship at WEF
item.description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang calls on the international community to take constructive actions in carrying out international economic and trade cooperation. Bloomberg's panel on The China Show breaks down his statements at World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Tianjin, also known as as “Summer Davos.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dollar Bond Issuance Jumps in Asia as Iran Truce Spurs Demand
item.description: Dollar bond issuance climbed in the Asia Pacific, led by Japan, after a ceasefire between Israel and Iran boosted investor appetite.
item.dc:creator: Finbarr Flynn, Ameya Karve

item.title: China’s State-Owned Miner Joins ‘Gold Rush’ to Raise Capital
item.description: Chinese gold miners have been flocking to offshore capital markets to raise funds, fueled by the precious metal’s bullish outlook as prices soar to record highs.
item.dc:creator: Apple Ka Ying Li, Shuiyu Jing, Jessica Zhou

item.title: Investors Focus on HDB Financial’s $1.4 billion Listing as India's IPO Gauge Struggles
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: Gold Holds Decline as Israel-Iran Ceasefire Saps Haven Demand
item.description: Gold held a decline as a shaky Iran-Israel ceasefire appeared to hold, reducing demand for haven assets.
item.dc:creator: Yihui Xie

item.title: China Seizes Moment to Globalize Yuan as Dollar Doubts Mount
item.description: China is launching a sweeping campaign to promote the yuan’s global role, seizing what officials see as a rare strategic opening.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Wenjin Lv

item.title: Trump Baffles With Sudden U-Turn on China Buying Iranian Oil
item.description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday appeared to undermine years of US sanctions on Iran, giving its biggest customer China the green light to carry on buying its oil as he seeks to bolster a ceasefire with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Grant Smith, Ben Bartenstein, Daniel Flatley, Mia Gindis

item.title: Trump's U-Turn on China Buying Iranian Oil
item.description: Randa Slim, John Hopkins University SAIS Senior Fellow, speaks to Bloomberg TV about the truce between Israel and Iran after US President Donald Trump suggested China can continue to purchase oil from Iran. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chinese Copper Smelters Ramp Up Exports to Escape Squeeze on LME
item.description: An historic squeeze in the copper market has put pressure on some Chinese smelters, prompting them to ramp up exports in a bid to cover their positions on the London Metal Exchange.
item.dc:creator: Julian Luk, Alfred Cang, Winnie Zhu

item.title: New Zealand’s Xero to Buy Melio Payments in $2.5 Billion Deal
item.description: Xero Ltd., a cloud-based accounting software firm, agreed to buy Melio Payments Inc. for $2.5 billion as the New Zealand company pushes deeper into the US market with its biggest-ever acquisition.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Adam Haigh

media:content.media:description: A woman working from home with a laptop computer and mobile phone in the U.K. Photographer: Bloomberg Creative Photos/Bloomberg Creative Collection

item.title: Dollar’s Falling Volatility Creates Appeal as Carry-Trade Funder
item.description: Selling the dollar to invest in emerging-market currencies looks increasingly appealing, as greenback volatility drops relative to other traditional funders, according to a Bloomberg analysis.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wong

item.title: 'Tactically Positive' on China Equities, Nomura's Seth Says
item.description: Nomura's Chetan Seth shares his outlook for Asian equities on Bloomberg Television. Seth says the firm is telling clients to "focus on some idiosyncratic themes, areas of the markets where we see better visibility and upside potential." He also says Nomura is "tactically positive" on Greater China. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: MSCI Keeps South Korea’s Emerging-Market Status in Review
item.description: South Korea’s bid for a developed-market status hit a setback after MSCI Inc. kept the country in the emerging-market category following a review, citing limited foreign exchange reforms and restricted availability of investment instruments.
item.dc:creator: Sangmi Cha

item.title: Inside a Chinese Toy Factory - The 90-day Race
item.description: Inside a toy factory in China's southern manufacturing hub Shenzhen, workers are racing against the clock to fulfill a surge of American orders — taking advantage of the 90-day trade war truce between the US and China. Before the pause in tensions, many Chinese exporters had frozen their U.S. business, or even considered pulling out entirely. Bloomberg TV's Minmin Low explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Rally as Mideast Tensions Ease | The Close 6/24/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Andrew Slimmon Morgan Stanley, Jeremy Siegel Wharton, Sharon Zackfia William Blair, Kurt Volker Former Ambassador to NATO, Yung-Yu Ma PNC Asset Management Group, Ruchir Sharma Breakout Capital. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: With Returns Down to 1%, Chinese Bond Traders Bet on Arbitrage
item.description: China’s government bond yields have been going sideways for months but traders have found at least one way to juice up returns: arbitrage.
item.dc:creator: Iris Ouyang, Jing Zhao

item.title: Goldman’s Chambers Sees Currency Hedges Accelerate Dollar’s Fall
item.description: The dollar is likely to extend its worst start to a year as foreign investors boost their currency hedges, according to Richard Chambers, global head of repo-trading at Goldman Sachs Group.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie

item.title: Ping An Builds $23 Billion Stake in China Banks on Dividend Bet
item.description: Ping An Insurance Group Co., as well as other Chinese insurers, have ramped up investments in the nation’s biggest banks on a bet the dividend yields will outweigh headwinds of narrower margins and earnings pressure.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Zheng Li, Dingmin Zhang, Mengchen Lu

media:content.media:description: The Ping An International Financial Center in Beijing, China, on Thursday, Nov. 9, 2023. Ping An Insurance (Group) Co. said it doesn’t hold any shares in Country Garden Holdings Co. and has no plans to acquire the distressed Chinese developer, refuting a report that sent the insurance giant’s stock tumbling on Wednesday.

item.title: Daiwa Plans $690 Million Real Estate Fund as Japan Market Booms
item.description: Daiwa Securities Group Inc. plans to launch a real estate fund with two partners, tapping investor demand for a piece of Japan’s booming property market.
item.dc:creator: Ryo Horiuchi

media:content.media:description: The building housing the headquarters of Daiwa Securities Group Inc. in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, Oct. 25, 2024. Daiwa Securities is scheduled to report its earnings figures on Oct. 29.

item.title: Hong Kong Developer Sought Loans Backed by Picasso, Warhol Art
item.description: A Hong Kong property dynasty that became one of the city’s most prolific collectors is discovering the limits of the burgeoning world of art-backed lending.
item.dc:creator: Kari Soo Lindberg, Venus Feng

media:content.media:description: Picasso's "Femme tenant un chat dans ses Bras" Photographer: Odd Andersen/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Trump and World Leaders Gather for NATO Family Photo
item.description: President Donald Trump and other NATO leaders arrived at the Royal Palace in the Hague, Netherlands on Tuesday evening for a royal dinner hosted by King Willem-Alexander in The Hague.

item.title: Citadel Securities Seeks to Stop Launch of IEX Options Venue
item.description: Citadel Securities is asking the Securities and Exchange Commission to stop a new exchange founded by the stars of Michael Lewis’s 2014 book Flash Boys from entering the options market.
item.dc:creator: Bernard Goyder, Katherine Doherty

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.
